title: Style
description:
The new CSLN Style model.

This is the target schema for CSLN, featuring declarative options and simple template components instead of procedural conditionals.

oneOf.description: Use the localized term for "and" (e.g., "and" in English).
Use the localized symbol for "and" (e.g., "&" in English).

Context-sensitive conjunction based on the citation mode.

This allows styles like APA 7th to use "and" in narrative (integral) citations but "&" in parenthetical (non-integral) ones.

integral.description: The option to use for integral/narrative citations (e.g., "Smith and Jones").

non-integral.description: The option to use for non-integral/parenthetical citations (e.g., "(Smith & Jones)"). Also typically serves as the default for bibliographies.

AndOtherOptions.description: How to render "and others" / et al.

entry-suffix.description: Suffix appended to each bibliography entry (e.g., "."). Extracted from CSL 1.0 `<layout suffix=".">` attribute. If None, a trailing period is added by default unless entry ends with DOI/URL.

hanging-indent.description: Whether to use a hanging indent.

separator.description: Separator between bibliography components (e.g., ". " for Chicago/APA, ", " for Elsevier). Extracted from CSL 1.0 group delimiter attribute. Defaults to ". " if not specified.

subsequent-author-substitute.description: String to substitute for repeating authors (e.g., "———").

subsequent-author-substitute-rule.description: Rule for when to apply the substitute.

suppress-period-after-url.description: Whether to suppress the trailing period after URLs/DOIs. Default behavior is to add a period (Chicago, MLA style). Set to true to suppress the period (APA 7th, Bluebook style).

template.description: The default template for bibliography entries.

type-templates.description: Type-specific template overrides. When present, replaces the default template for entries of the specified types. Keys are reference type names (e.g., "chapter", "article-journal").

use-preset.description: Reference to an embedded template preset. If both `use_preset` and `template` are present, `template` takes precedence.

delimiter.description: Delimiter between components within a single citation item (e.g., ", " or " "). Defaults to ", ".

integral.description: Configuration for integral (narrative) citations (e.g., "Smith (2020)"). Overrides fields from the main citation spec when mode is Integral.

multi-cite-delimiter.description: Delimiter between multiple citation items (e.g., "; "). Defaults to "; ".

non-integral.description: Configuration for non-integral (parenthetical) citations (e.g., "(Smith, 2020)"). Overrides fields from the main citation spec when mode is NonIntegral.

prefix.description: Prefix for the citation (use only when `wrap` doesn't suffice, e.g., " (" or "[Ref ").

suffix.description: Suffix for the citation (use only when `wrap` doesn't suffice).

use-preset.description: Reference to an embedded template preset. If both `use_preset` and `template` are present, `template` takes precedence.

wrap.description: Wrap the entire citation in punctuation. Preferred over prefix/suffix.

punctuation-in-quote.description: Whether to place periods/commas inside quotation marks. true = American style ("text."), false = British style ("text".) Defaults to false; en-US locale typically sets this to true.

semantic-classes.description: Whether to output semantic markup (HTML spans, Djot attributes). Defaults to true.

volume-pages-delimiter.description: Delimiter between volume/issue and pages for serial sources. Processor adds trailing space when rendering. Examples: Comma (APA ", "), Colon (Chicago ": ").

delimiter-precedes-et-al.description: When to include delimiter before "et al.".

delimiter-precedes-last.description: When to include delimiter before the last contributor.

demote-non-dropping-particle.description: Handling of non-dropping particles (e.g., "van" in "van Gogh").

display-as-sort.description: When to display a contributor's name in sort order.

initialize-with.description: String to append after initialized given names (e.g., ". " for "J. Smith"). If None, full given names are used (e.g., "John Smith").

initialize-with-hyphen.description: Whether to include a hyphen when initializing names (e.g., "J.-P. Sartre").

role.description: When and how to display contributor roles.

shorten.description: Shorten the list of contributors (et al. handling).

sort-separator.description: Delimiter between family and given name when inverted (default: ", ").

approximation-marker.description: Marker for approximate dates (e.g., "ca. " or "~"). None suppresses display.

open-range-marker.description: Marker for open-ended ranges (e.g., "–present"). None uses locale default.

uncertainty-marker.description: Marker for uncertain dates (e.g., "?" or "uncertain"). None suppresses display.

DelimiterPrecedesLast.description: When to use delimiter before last contributor.

DisplayAsSort.description: When to display names in sort order (family-first).

GeneralTerm.description: A list of general terms for citation formatting.

oneOf.description: Link the specific component this config is attached to.

anchor.description: What text should be hyperlinked (title, url, etc.).

doi.description: Link value to the item's DOI.

target.description: The target for the link (url, doi, etc.).

url.description: Link value to the item's URL.

oneOf.description: Combine multiple views (e.g., "transliterated [translated]"). For now, this is a placeholder for more complex formatting strings.

Rendering.description:
Rendering instructions applied to template components.

These fields are flattened into parent structs, so in YAML you write: ```yaml - title: primary emph: true prefix: "In " ``` Rather than nesting under a `rendering:` key.

inner-prefix.description: Text to prepend inside the wrap.

inner-suffix.description: Text to append inside the wrap.

prefix.description: Text to prepend to the rendered value (outside any wrap).

suffix.description: Text to append to the rendered value (outside any wrap).

suppress.description: If true, suppress this component entirely (render as empty string). Useful for type-specific overrides like suppressing publisher for journals.

wrap.description: Punctuation to wrap the value in (e.g., parentheses).

omit.description: Contributor roles for which to omit the role description.

use-native-ordering.description: Whether to use native ordering for this script (e.g., FamilyGiven for CJK).

delimiter-precedes-last.description: When to use delimiter before last name.

min.description: Minimum number of names to trigger shortening.

use-first.description: Number of names to show when shortened.

use-last.description: Number of names to show after the ellipsis (et-al-use-last).

render-substitutions.description: Use same substitutions for sorting as for rendering.

shorten-names.description: Shorten name lists for sorting the same as for display.

oneOf.description: Sort by citation order (for numeric styles).

default-locale.description: Default locale for the style (e.g., "en-US", "de-DE"). Used for locale-aware term resolution.

oneOf.description: Substitute only if ALL authors match.
Substitute each matching name until the first mismatch.
Substitute only the first name if it matches.

contributor-role-form.description: Form to use for contributor roles when substituting.

template.description: Ordered list of fields to try as substitutes.

SubstituteConfig.description: Substitution rules for missing author data.

SubstituteKey.description: Fields that can be used as author substitutes.

SubstitutePreset.description:
Substitute presets for author substitution fallback logic.

These presets define the order in which fields are tried when the primary author is missing. Most styles follow the standard order, but some have variations.

oneOf.description: Standard substitution order: Editor → Title → Translator. Used by most citation styles (APA, Chicago, etc.).
Editor-first: Editor → Translator → Title. Prioritizes contributors over title.
Title-first: Title → Editor → Translator. Used when anonymous works should show title prominently.

TemplateComponent.description:
A template component - the building blocks of citation/bibliography templates.

Each variant handles a specific data type with appropriate formatting options.
